name: Rajani Gulab
description: A rose attar composed in the old north-Indian manner—petal-forward, quiet, and precise. It opens with a cool rose sheen and a whisper of saffron, like the first light on temple stone.
As it warms, the heart becomes fuller and more devotional: Damask richness tempered by honeyed pollen rather than sugar. The effect is intimate and skin-close—an aura, not a cloud.

The base settles into sandalwood and resin for longevity, with a clean musk finish that reads modern without losing heritage rhythm. Wear at dusk, for prayer, or for conversations that don’t need volume.

images.alt: A minimal rose still life in warm cream light
images.unsplash_query: rose petals still life cream minimal

images.alt: Antique brass vessel with soft golden highlights

name: Samraj Oud
description: A disciplined oud that favors structure over theatrics. The opening is resinous and dry, with pepper and cedar for definition rather than heat.
The heart is oud rendered architectural: wood grain, shadow, and a measured patchouli spine. It reads royal, but never ornate—like indigo cloth with a single gold stitch.
The base is labdanum and dark amber for endurance, designed to sit close and last. Ideal for winter evenings, formal wear, and anyone who prefers quiet authority.

images.alt: Dark wood texture with warm highlights

name: Mandir Mogra
description: Morning jasmine, rendered calm. The opening is bud-green and dewy, like garlands unwrapped before the first bell.
In the heart, mogra becomes full petal and breathable—white floral without sharp indoles. It feels devotional, not perfumey.
Sandalwood and a soft powdery rice nuance anchor the base for longevity while staying light. A gentle attar for meditation and daily wear.

images.alt: White jasmine flowers against a soft cream background

name: Chandan Shastra
description: Sandalwood as scholarship: creamy, steady, and clean. The opening is smooth milkwood with a restrained cardamom lift.
The heart builds warmth without heaviness—soft spice and gentle resin that feel like lamplight on paper.
A golden wood base stays close and comforting, designed for long study sessions, prayer, and evenings at home.

images.alt: Soft light on minimal wood and paper textures

name: Vetiver Sutra
description: A cooling vetiver (khush) designed for heat and clarity. The opening is earthy-clean with a faint citrus peel to sharpen the silhouette.
The heart is rooty and herbal, dry rather than sweet—modern minimalism with traditional material integrity.
Dry woods and mineral musk keep it composed for long wear. Wear for summer days, work, and calm conversations.

images.alt: Clean green field texture in soft light

name: Temple Dhoop
description: Incense in a minimalist register—smoke, resin, and devotion without heaviness. The opening is frankincense smoke with a clove shadow.
The heart is temple resin: myrrh-like depth and saffron warmth, balanced to remain breathable.
Benzoin and sandalwood create a slow, comforting base that reads sacred and calm. A natural companion for prayer, evening rituals, and winter air.

images.alt: Warm incense smoke rising in low light

name: Noor Kesar
description: Saffron light with a creamy halo. The opening is kesar and warm milk—not gourmand, but luminous and soft.
The heart glows with amber and a faint rose tint, creating a royal warmth that reads refined rather than sweet.
A sandalwood base carries the glow for hours with a vanilla nuance kept deliberately quiet. Best for festive evenings and winter gatherings.

images.alt: Saffron threads on a neutral cream surface

name: Mehfil Amber
description: An amber designed for gatherings: warm, polished, and quietly magnetic. The opening gives a clean citrus edge to keep the glow modern.
The heart is resin-amber with rosewood smoothness—soft gold on cream, never loud.
Benzoin and labdanum deepen the base for long wear, finished with a clean musk for a tailored trail.

images.alt: Warm golden bokeh in soft focus

name: Nargis Noor
description: Narcissus (nargis) as a clean floral: stem-green and bright at first, like cool air through a corridor.
The heart is floral with a hint of honey and iris-like dryness—elegant, not powdery.
Musk and sandalwood create a smooth base that stays close for long wear, ideal for daytime refinement.

images.alt: White flowers in minimal cream light

name: Kesar Chandan
description: A classic pairing—saffron and sandal—composed with modern restraint. The opening reads warm and polished rather than sweet.
The heart is creamy sandalwood under a soft amber light, like gold leaf used sparingly.
The base is calm and enduring, made to settle into skin and fabric edges. A refined signature for work and ceremonies alike.

images.alt: Warm neutral minimal interior with soft light

name: Green Shahi
description: A modern green attar with heritage materials. The opening is citrus and mint—cool and bright without sharpness.
The heart is tea-like and herbal with clean floral air, designed for warm climates and daily repetition.
Dry woods and musk keep the base quiet and long-lasting. A minimal signature for office, travel, and summer evenings.

images.alt: Fresh green leaves in soft daylight

name: Resin Rahasya
description: A resin-focused attar for nights when you want depth without density. It opens with elemi and citrus rind, a bright edge against smoke.
The heart is frankincense and myrrh with saffron warmth, built like incense that never overwhelms the room.
Benzoin and amber form a long base that stays calm, slightly mineral, and meditative. Ideal for winter, travel, and quiet resilience.

images.alt: Soft smoke in warm low light
